intro: Vernonia ctenophora, commonly known as the spike vernonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers arranged in dense spikes, which are often surrounded by bracts. Vernonia ctenophora is typically found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils, and it thrives in full sun. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
